_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary 



OXARC, Inc.

500 S. Main Ave.

Pasco, WA 99301



PROCESS: Storage of Chlorine and Sulfur Dioxide Ton-Containers and 150 Pound Cylinders



1.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

We are OXARC, Inc. are strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as receipt of containers and product, storage, and employee training associated with the chemicals at this facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. 



Under the Accidental Release Prevention Program, responsibility for the proper handling and storage of toxic gases stored at this facility is overseen by the production manager and by the Compliance Assistant. Additionally, OXARC, Inc. senior management have responsibility to ensure facility managers and compliance personnel keep the program up-to-date and that all reports and findings are taken care of in a timely manner.



2.    The Regulated Substances Handled

The facility is accessible to about 20 authorized employees and is secured during non-operational hours.  There are two substances at this facility above the threshold quantity: sulfur dioxide and chlorine (separate, not in mixtures) in cylinders with capacities of 150 pounds and 2000 pounds. The estimated maximum amount of sulfur dioxide on hand is approximately 32,000 pounds total in the containers listed above. The maximum amount of chlorine on hand is approximately 60,000 pounds in the containers listed above. There are no filling processes performed of either chemical at this facility. Only processes associated with sulfur dioxide and chlorine are the storage, loading/unloading, and transportation in and out of this location.



3.    General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

This facility has taken all of the necessary

steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68 of the EPA. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place at this facility.



Process Safety Information. OXARC, Inc. maintains safety information that describes the chemical hazards, handling, and storage of the regulated substance at this facility. All affected personnel are trained on hazmat handling.



Process Hazard Analysis. This facility conducts reviews to ensure that hazards associated with the handling, storage, and filling of cylinders are identified and controlled efficiently. Any findings related the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner. The most recent PHA review was performed on 03/30/2017.



Operating Procedures. For the purpose of safely handling, filling, and storing cylinders, OXARC, Inc. has written procedures that address the loading and unloading of ton containers, as well as the safe handling of 150 pound cylinders.



Training. OXARC, Inc. has a comprehensive program in place to ensure employees who are responsible for the handling of hazardous substances are competent in the procedures. Refresher training is provided on an ongoing basis.



Mechanical Integrity. OXARC, Inc. takes great care in ensuring that the structural integrity of the containers and cylinders is maintained throughout the handling and storage of these containers, cylinders, and any equipment associated with the process. Cylinders and ton containers at this facility are not subject to any operations other than storage and handling. Equipment used for these operations are maintained to ensure integrity and safety.



Management of Change. The most recent review/revision of procedures was performed on 3/30/2017. Employees whose job tasks are affected by a modification in the operating procedures are promptly made aware of and trained in these changes. 



Compliance Audits. The resubmission of this RMP has pr

ompted the facility to conduct a compliance audit. Performed on 3/30/2017.



Incident Investigation. OXARC, Inc. promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could result in an unintentional release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years. There has not been an incident at this facility.



Employee Participation. OXARC, Inc. believes that safety management and accident prevention is a team effort. OXARC employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of this facility's implementation of the RMP rule, including information resulting from any hazard analyses.



Contractors. On occasion, OXARC, Inc. hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety of the contractor is carried out. OXARC has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractors work and the processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release occur. However, contractors are not involved with any process relating to the regulated chemicals.



4.    Five-Year Accident History

There is no accident history to report.



5.    Emergency Response Plan

OXARC, Inc. has an Emergency Action Plan in lieu of an Emergency Response Plan due to the few employees on-site during operations. The plan includes all required aspects of the Action Plan and was created using "OSHA's Emergency Action Plan Expert System". The plan identifies alerts, what to do in the event of an emergency, evacuation, extinguishers, operations, employee duties, and meeting points and ac

countability.



Franklin County LEPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee covering this facility.



6.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

OXARC, Inc. has no plans at the present time.



HAZARD REVIEW



A hazard review was performed at the 500 S. Main Ave. location on 3/30/2017 to determine what hazards are present for the handling and storage of chlorine and sulfur dioxide.
